title: Wooden stake
data:
| ) [![Wooden stake.png](/images/9/94/Wooden_stake.png)](/wiki/File:Wooden_stake.png) |                                                         |
| ----------------------------------------------------------------------------------- | ------------------------------------------------------- |
| Name                                                                                | wooden stake                                            |
| Appearance                                                                          | wooden stake                                            |
| Damage vs. small                                                                    | 1d6                                                     |
| Damage vs. large                                                                    | 1d6                                                     |
| To-hit bonus                                                                        | +0                                                      |
| Weapon skill                                                                        | [dagger](/wiki/Dagger "Dagger")                         |
| Size                                                                                | [one-handed](/wiki/One-handed "One-handed")             |
| Base price                                                                          | 50 [zm](/wiki/Zorkmid "Zorkmid") (+10/positive enchant) |
| Weight                                                                              | [20](/wiki/Weight "Weight")                             |
| Material                                                                            | [wood](/wiki/Wood "Wood")                               |

The **wooden stake** is a starting item for the [Undead Slayer](/wiki/Undead_Slayer "Undead Slayer") in [SLASH'EM](/wiki/SLASH%27EM "SLASH'EM"). [The Stake of Van Helsing](/wiki/The_Stake_of_Van_Helsing "The Stake of Van Helsing") is an artifact wooden stake.

A stake does 1d6 extra damage to any [vampire](/wiki/Vampire "Vampire"), with additional 2 damage and 10% chance of [instakilling](/wiki/Instakill "Instakill") if one of the following applies: you are an [Undead Slayer](/wiki/Undead_Slayer "Undead Slayer"), you have Expert [proficiency](/wiki/Skill "Skill") in dagger, or the stake is the aforementioned artifact.

[ ]

## Contents

- [1 Generation](#Generation)

- [2 Variants](#Variants)

  - [2.1 SLASHTHEM](#SLASHTHEM)
  - [2.2 Hack'EM](#Hack.27EM)
  - [2.3 Bonus insta-kills vs vampires:](#Bonus_insta-kills_vs_vampires:)

## Generation

Wooden stakes do not generate randomly in SLASH'EM.

The [undead slayer](/wiki/Undead_slayer "Undead slayer") role always starts with a +0 wooden stake.

## Variants

### [SLASHTHEM](/wiki/SLASHTHEM "SLASHTHEM")

Wooden stakes can generate randomly in the dungeon with a rare frequency.

### [Hack'EM](/wiki/Hack%27EM "Hack'EM")

- Wooden stakes are instead just known as "stakes" and can generate in these materials: WOOD, MINERAL, IRON, METAL, MITHRIL, BONE, COPPER, and SILVER.
- Stakes can generate randomly in the dungeon with a fairly rare frequency.
- Base cost of 20 instead of 50.
- Stakes get a +1 to-hit bonus vs vampires.
- Untrapping a [spear trap](/index.php?title=Spear_trap\&action=edit\&redlink=1 "Spear trap (page does not exist)") has a chance of yielding a stake.

### Bonus insta-kills vs vampires:

- The instakill probability is a bit different from SLASH'EM.
- You have a higher probability of staking the heart of a [vampire](/wiki/Vampire "Vampire") based on your dagger skill, if you are an [Undead Slayer](/wiki/Undead_Slayer "Undead Slayer"), and if it's [The Stake of Van Helsing](/wiki/The_Stake_of_Van_Helsing "The Stake of Van Helsing").

These bonuses all stack, as demonstrated below:

- No skill in dagger = 10% chance of instakill
- Basic in dagger = 20% chance of instakill
- Skilled in dagger = 30% chance of instakill
- Expert in dagger = 40% chance of instakill
- Expert in dagger and an undead slayer = 50% chance of instakill
- Expert in dagger and an undead slayer wielding the Stake of Van Helsing = 60% chance of instakill

If you don't get the instakill, you still always get a bonus +1d6 damage vs the vampire like in SLASH'EM. Instead of +2 you get a bonus based on the above bonuses. Just take the probability of instakill and divide by 10 for the damage bonus.

- Monsters wielding stakes always have a 20% instakill rate against you if you are a vampire.
- Vampires are not vulnerable to stakes while in different forms (like [vampire bats](/wiki/Vampire_bat "Vampire bat")).

[![This article may require revision for the next version of SLASH'EM. Click here for more information.](/images/3/38/Se7e7-icon.png)](/wiki/NetHackWiki:Next_version "This article may require revision for the next version of SLASH'EM. Click here for more information.")

Wooden stake

From NetHackWiki
Jump to navigation Jump to search
)
Name wooden stake
Appearance wooden stake
Damage vs. small 1d6
Damage vs. large 1d6
To-hit bonus +0
Weapon skill dagger
Size one-handed
Base price 50 zm
(+10/positive
enchant)
Weight 20
Material wood

The wooden stake is a starting item for the Undead Slayer in SLASH'EM. The Stake of Van Helsing is an artifact wooden stake.

A stake does 1d6 extra damage to any vampire, with additional 2 damage and 10% chance of instakilling if one of the following applies: you are an Undead Slayer, you have Expert proficiency in dagger, or the stake is the aforementioned artifact.

Contents

  • 1 Generation
  • 2 Variants
    • 2.1 SLASHTHEM
    • 2.2 Hack'EM
    • 2.3 Bonus insta-kills vs vampires:

Generation

Wooden stakes do not generate randomly in SLASH'EM.

The undead slayer role always starts with a +0 wooden stake.

Variants

SLASHTHEM

Wooden stakes can generate randomly in the dungeon with a rare frequency.

Hack'EM

  • Wooden stakes are instead just known as "stakes" and can generate in these materials: WOOD, MINERAL, IRON, METAL, MITHRIL, BONE, COPPER, and SILVER.
  • Stakes can generate randomly in the dungeon with a fairly rare frequency.
  • Base cost of 20 instead of 50.
  • Stakes get a +1 to-hit bonus vs vampires.
  • Untrapping a spear trap has a chance of yielding a stake.

Bonus insta-kills vs vampires:

  • The instakill probability is a bit different from SLASH'EM.
  • You have a higher probability of staking the heart of a vampire based on your dagger skill, if you are an Undead Slayer, and if it's The Stake of Van Helsing.

These bonuses all stack, as demonstrated below:

  • No skill in dagger = 10% chance of instakill
  • Basic in dagger = 20% chance of instakill
  • Skilled in dagger = 30% chance of instakill
  • Expert in dagger = 40% chance of instakill
  • Expert in dagger and an undead slayer = 50% chance of instakill
  • Expert in dagger and an undead slayer wielding the Stake of Van Helsing = 60% chance of instakill

If you don't get the instakill, you still always get a bonus +1d6 damage vs the vampire like in SLASH'EM. Instead of +2 you get a bonus based on the above bonuses. Just take the probability of instakill and divide by 10 for the damage bonus.

  • Monsters wielding stakes always have a 20% instakill rate against you if you are a vampire.
  • Vampires are not vulnerable to stakes while in different forms (like vampire bats).

The '''wooden stake''' is a starting item for the [[Undead Slayer]] in [[SLASH'EM]]. [[The Stake of Van Helsing]] is an artifact wooden stake.

A stake does 1d6 extra damage to any [[vampire]], with additional 2 damage and 10% chance of [[instakill]]ing if one of the following applies:
you are an [[Undead Slayer]], you have Expert [[skill|proficiency]] in dagger, or the stake is the aforementioned artifact.

==Generation==
Wooden stakes do not generate randomly in SLASH'EM.

The [[undead slayer]] role always starts with a +0 wooden stake.

==Variants==
===[[SLASHTHEM]]===
Wooden stakes can generate randomly in the dungeon with a rare frequency.

===[[Hack'EM]]===
* Wooden stakes are instead just known as "stakes" and can generate in these materials: WOOD, MINERAL, IRON, METAL, MITHRIL, BONE, COPPER, and SILVER.
* Stakes can generate randomly in the dungeon with a fairly rare frequency.
* Base cost of 20 instead of 50.
* Stakes get a +1 to-hit bonus vs vampires.
* Untrapping a [[spear trap]] has a chance of yielding a stake.

=== Bonus insta-kills vs vampires:===
* The instakill probability is a bit different from SLASH'EM.
* You have a higher probability of staking the heart of a [[vampire]] based on your dagger skill, if you are an [[Undead Slayer]], and if it's [[The Stake of Van Helsing]].

These bonuses all stack, as demonstrated below:
* No skill in dagger = 10% chance of instakill
* Basic in dagger = 20% chance of instakill
* Skilled in dagger = 30% chance of instakill
* Expert in dagger = 40% chance of instakill
* Expert in dagger and an undead slayer = 50% chance of instakill
* Expert in dagger and an undead slayer wielding the Stake of Van Helsing = 60% chance of instakill

If you don't get the instakill, you still always get a bonus +1d6 damage vs the vampire like in SLASH'EM. 
Instead of +2 you get a bonus based on the above bonuses. Just take the probability of instakill and divide by 10 for the damage bonus.

* Monsters wielding stakes always have a 20% instakill rate against you if you are a vampire.
* Vampires are not vulnerable to stakes while in different forms (like [[vampire bat]]s).
